of your brim then fold your work with the wrong sides facing and knit the cast-on edge together with your live stitches to create a folded brim after folding the brim you ll work a short amount of 2x2 ribbing to help the hat sit snugly on your head-- this won t be visible when the brim is folded up then you ll work a setup round placing stitch markers at designated intervals to differentiate between your stockinette knit and reverse stockinette purl stitches decreases are made on either side of the purl sections and you seam your hat by grafting the purl section stitches together measures 5 6 6 6 from the cast-on edge foldthebrim fold the brim in half so that the wrong sides face each other knit the first stitch on your needle together with the first cast-on stitch continue until all cast-on stitches have been knit together with their corresponding live stitch and you reach the bor i like to use a smaller needle to pick up one leg of each stitch from the cast-on edge before i start knitting stitches together alternatively you can go one stitch at a time using the right needle to pick up a cast-on stitch and slip it onto the left needle then knit two stitches
